definition: to pace back and forth/to hesitate/to waver
enormously proud of one's success (idiom); smug/complacent
to hesitate to move forward/to hesitate/to hold back

sentences.english: The complexity of hukou reform daunts Chinese leaders.
sentences.chinese: 户籍改革的艰巨和复杂性让政府踌躇不前。

sentences.english: He doesn’t hesitate to enter the ur anymore.
sentences.chinese: 他不再对乌尔地区踌躇不前。

sentences.english: My thought struggled at confessing, somehow hesitation ended in flinching.
sentences.chinese: 然妾心忏悔，百般挣扎，踌躇彷徨，畏葸不前。

sentences.english: No good is ever done in this world by hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 在这世界上踌躇不决成绩不了任何事。

sentences.english: The prospect of flattening a Pakistani city made Obama pause.
sentences.chinese: 夷平一座巴基斯坦城市的后果让奥巴马踌躇了。

sentences.english: Scottish – The act of hestitating while introducing someone because you’ve forgotten their name.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰语，介绍他人时因忘记名字而犹豫踌躇的表现。

sentences.english: She is ambitious to get through high school in two years.
sentences.chinese: 她踌躇满志，要在两年内完成高中学业。

sentences.english: At that moment, a lost kid constantly wonders, wanders, and flounders.
sentences.chinese: 在那时，一个迷失的小孩疑惑着，彷徨着，踌躇着。

sentences.english: Don't hang on, nothing lasts forever but the earth and sky.
sentences.chinese: 别踌躇了，万物莫能不朽，唯有天与地。

sentences.english: And slowly, diffidently, the number of these sheets has grown.
sentences.chinese: 书稿缓慢地，踌躇地一页页增加。

sentences.english: The foot wiggled a little and the toes flexed as my finger reached them.
sentences.chinese: 足部稍微踌躇，而且足趾屈曲如我的手指联络了他们。

sentences.english: Phil walked forward confidently but something held Ben back.
sentences.chinese: 菲尔信心十足地走向前去，本却踌躇不定。

sentences.english: She held back，not knowing how to tell him the bad news.
sentences.chinese: 她踌躇着不知道应该怎么把这个坏消息告诉他。

sentences.english: But shoppers have been made hesitant by high unemployment and falling home prices.
sentences.chinese: 然而高企的失业率和下跌的房价却令购物者踌躇再三。

sentences.english: I hesitated to move ahead, feeling perplexed and melancholy.
sentences.chinese: 我踌躇不前，不由感到一阵迷惑和惆怅。

sentences.english: Some scruples and some reluctance the widower-father may be supposed to have felt;
sentences.chinese: 可以料想，那丧偶的父亲心里有些顾虑，有些踌躇。

definition: to ponder/to reckon/to turn sth over in one's mind
variant of 踟躕|踟蹰[chi2 chu2]
to reckon/to consider/to turn over in one's mind
variant of 躊躇|踌躇[chou2 chu2]
to think sth through/to consider carefully
to want to say sth but then hesitate
